conversation.content: [measured] So, uh, you wanted to check on the holster order? Because honestly, I wasn't expecting you back until next week when it's actually finished.
[casually] Yeah, well, I was in the neighborhood and figured I'd stop by, see how it's coming along. You know how it is, sometimes plans change. [pause]
[carefully] Right, plans change. Um, the thing is, I've been getting some interesting requests lately from other customers about, well, similar work.
Oh yeah? That's good for business, right? I mean, custom leather work like yours, it's not exactly common anymore, so word must be spreading about your craftsmanship.
[quieter] The Serpents came by yesterday, actually. Three of them. They were, uh, very interested in who else shops here, especially anyone ordering concealed carry gear. [nervous exhale]
[controlled] Hmm, that must've been uncomfortable for you. Those guys can be pretty intense when they want information about something. What did you tell them?
[strained] Nothing, I mean, I told them nothing specific, but they're not stupid, you know? They saw your order form on my bench before I could cover it up.
[firmly] I see.

[desperately] Look, I don't know what you're really doing here, okay? But whatever it is, I've got a family, and these guys, they don't just threaten, they actually follow through on that shit. [voice breaking]
Hey, listen to me, alright? Nobody's asking you to get involved in anything. You're just making a holster, that's all this needs to be. [deliberate pause]
[bitter laugh] Just making a holster. Right. Except your measurements are for a Glock 19, and I know for a fact that's not what the Serpents carry because I've made holsters for half of them.
[deflecting] People carry different pieces for different occasions. That's not really unusual in certain circles, and I think you know that. [clears throat]
[hollow] You're going to get me killed, aren't you? My wife, she was right, I should've closed shop when the Serpents first started coming around two years ago.
Nobody's getting hurt here, okay? I need you to trust me on this, even if I can't explain everything right now. [sighs heavily]
[resigned] Trust you. Sure. The guy with the fake name on his order form wants me to trust him while my regular customers are asking questions I can't answer.
Can't answer yet.
[defeated whisper] Whatever.
Look, um, finish the holster by Friday instead of next week, and I'll pay triple your rate. After that, maybe you take a vacation for a while, yeah? [trailing off]
[drained] A vacation. With what money? You think triple rate on one holster is going to replace six months of lost business when word gets out I'm mixed up in... whatever this is?
[quietly firm] When this is over, and it will be over soon, you'll have more business than you know what to do with. The right kind of business. [long pause] That's all I can say.
